website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive little game that never gets old and can be enjoyed by kids or adults.
pros: If you’re looking for a game that you can play with your kids (and that your kids can handily beat you at), Spot It!
is a simple but deceptively tricky game
The rules are simple: spot the image that your card has in common with the center card before the other players
Comes in a tin that is perfect for travel
cons: Losing streaks can be frustrating, and some players may struggle to compete

customer_reviews.title: It's time to say NO to wasteful and deceptive packaging
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game, but others (Dobble) make essentially the same game, and so I'm going to pan this one on grounds of the wasteful and deceptive packaging. You'll have to plow through three layers of plastic to get to the cards. The box is twice as large as the can, with plenty of plastic to disguise that fact, and the can is 50% larger than the cards.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Alyson

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the whole family- seriously!
customer_reviews.text: When I first read the description of this game I thought it would be far too easy for anyone but my 5 year old to play. I mean, how hard can it be to find the same object on two different cards? Boy was I wrong! Between the two adults in our house, our 10 year old and our 5 year old, we're all equally challenged each time we play! It comes with directions to play various versions but we've been having so much fun with this one that we haven't wanted to change it up yet.
customer_reviews.author: MKE mom

customer_reviews.title: Super fun for ANY age!
customer_reviews.text: My kids all has so much fun playing this game. We modified the rules a bit for my 2.5 year old, and she played longer than her older brothers! We played it go fish style with all cards facing up, and she would ask each of us if we had something marching her card. Ex. "Do you have a red heart?" I love that it comes with a few different ways to play, but there are so many ways you can modify it for younger kids or even larger groups. You can make it super challenging (memory style), or super simple. I love that it's small enough to be taken anywhere. This would be perfect while waiting at a restaurant!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Lots of different ways to play
customer_reviews.text: I keep "school age" children every week for choir practice at my church. I liked this game because you didn't have to be able to read so Kindergarten and 6th graders could play together. There are a lot of different ways to play the game but I read the first set of instructions when we opened them and they started playing right away and have never wanted to learn a different way. I have about 50 games for the kids to choose from and this one ends up off the shelf every week even if just for a quick round.
customer_reviews.author: T-Wrecks

customer_reviews.title: From the packaging to the concept, this game is so unique and very fun!
customer_reviews.text: Learned about this game on the Living Well Spending Less FB blog page. I ordered it and it arrived quickly, what a great game. My boys and I love to play card games and this was like nothing we had played before, this game engaged everyone's attention and had us all cracking up. The cards are thick and won't rip easily and they come packaged in a cute tin, I believe it would be ideal for travel. I definately recommend this game, it's very versatile because it has many different mini games/modes so the monotony that comes with so many other games is not likely with Spot It.
customer_reviews.author: JillHdz

customer_reviews.title: Really simple, really fun! Younger kids will appreciate independence of play.
customer_reviews.text: Really fun game. I had never played before but I saw the reviews and decided to give it a try. I always purchase a new game for our family Christmas box which we all open together on Christmas eve and this was super easy to learn and really fun to play. My 5 year old begs to play it now with us frequently. It's really enjoyable to have games which he can play independently against us, be competetive and win so this was a huge winner in our book. Gameplay really never gets old, easy to pack up when you're done playing, super easy to throw into a bag and take camping ect. Can't wait to purchase the other versions!
customer_reviews.author: April D.

customer_reviews.title: This is a fun game even when you don't speak the same language!
customer_reviews.text: I am an adult and live in the U.S. and this was a gift for a 9 year old girl cousin who would be visiting us from Italy, and who does not speak English. This was the perfect gift and she loved it!!! Because the game consists of matching pictures, she and I were able to sit down immediately and play the game together even though we didn't speak the same language. Gradually, we began to say the names of the pictures in our own language and learn from each other.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Great game to play with family and friends
customer_reviews.text: Saw a youtuber ( zoella ) playing this game. Thats how i bought it . And since i dont like flying i had to distract myself the hole flight and I played this game with my mom , we were so loud. We had fun she won almost all of the rounds ! Its a fun game for playing with friends and family. Its great for your mind , teaches you how fast your able to recognize same things but in defferent sized and areas!
customer_reviews.author: Hadrianuss

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT GAME!
customer_reviews.text: ✔️ This is a fun game for any age. ✔️ Encourages you to think quick! ✔️Encourages you to sharpen your mind/sharpen your mental reflexes! ✔️ Very easy to learn. ✔️ Very reasonably priced. ✔️It comes in a lovely, round & sturdy tin holder. ✔️Easy to take on any trip. ✔️The kids can even play this on a road trip! ✔️I suggest that you take it in your Carry-on luggage, in case you get stuck in an airport. It would be great Entertainment while you wait! ✔️Great to give as a gift. ✔️ I would highly recommend this to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: LuckySeal

customer_reviews.title: A fun game to take on the go too!
customer_reviews.text: This game is really so much fun to play! It took just a few minutes to figure out but once we did, our family had a great time playing round after round. What's really nice is that the game and case itself is small enough to take along on trips, playdates, plane rides, or anywhere your family will have 15mins to sit down and play. I also think it's a great stocking stuffer or small just bc gift to give too. We've had this game for about 2 months or so and my kids ask to play at least 3x a week. Well worth the price of ten bucks and under.
customer_reviews.author: Sanriobaby

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: This game it’s awesome, I got to play it with friends at a trip and love it! You have to be fast and have good memory! Enjoy :)
customer_reviews.author: Mayi Barov

customer_reviews.title: What a Great Game!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our 7 year old grand daughter. Grandpa and our 4 year old grandson, our granddaughter and I played endless games the week we were together. I was amazed at how even the adults continually missed the match, but at the same time, how my 4 year old grandson was able to play as well, Most important, we laughed a lot while playing. I would definitely recommend it for home and classroom. I am hoping they will make new card sets as we get used to the one we have.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too simple
customer_reviews.text: I've raided the internet for age appropriate games for a 4yo and this came up on a few sites. My kid likes it, but I was hoping there'd be more going on. I prefer (and the little person also enjoys) matching games like Busytown Eye Found It, or a picture Bingo like Birthday bingo, bird bingo, or wildlife bingo.... I do like Spotify for long drives, but even then it's not ideal (too messy).
customer_reviews.author: Jessica H.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and great
customer_reviews.text: I'm a board game collector and a Youth Pastor so I teach board games a lot to kids. This game is simple enough that little kids can play it and if your group is older it can be very fast paced and competitive so the high schoolers really enjoy it. This game took 2-3 minutes to unbox and play, including teaching. Very simple with a few modes of playing which is nice. A great travel game as it's tiny and if you lose a sheet it's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Erom

customer_reviews.title: It's all ages appropriate and it's fun, get it!
customer_reviews.text: It's so hard to find a game that everyone from toddlers to adults can play, so when you find one, you go for it. This game is both super easy, but also pretty challenging. Just because you are an adult it doesn't mean you have an advantage over the young kids, which makes it the ideal game for families. The rules are simple to learn and remember, it's all ages appropriate, and it's fun. You can't go wrong, get it. :-)
customer_reviews.author: SewRusty

customer_reviews.title: Fun to place once or twice
customer_reviews.text: The game was creative and fun but it’s pretty much only usable for one or two games and then you have it memorized. My 5 year old had it memorized after two times and was bored with it.
customer_reviews.author: contessa zippay

customer_reviews.title: Even the little kids are able to play!
customer_reviews.text: All the kiddos and adults love this game! The metal tin container to keep the cards clean and contained, what a great idea! The 4 year olds can even play. The first day we played 2 adults, a barely 6 year old and a new 4 year old. The 4 year old we let her look at the card (we played the TOWER) for a count of 5, then the rest of us we allowed to look. Worked well... now she only gets a count of 3. Thank you for including the story behind the game, very interesting. I'm ordering it for my other two kid's families, one day we'll have a SPOT IT competition for all the cousins.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Finally my kids play together.
customer_reviews.text: We just received this game and my kids (11 and 8) are finally playing a game together that they can both agree on! Lol. We love that we can play it several different ways and that it's portable thanks to the sturdy storage tin. My 11 year old has not been able to put it down. It's simple to play yet very engaging. It's been a great addition to our homeschool days for downtime between lessons. Definitely recommend for kids and adults alike.
customer_reviews.author: B. Norris

customer_reviews.title: This game is a great travel game and the young children I have played ...
customer_reviews.text: This game is a great travel game and the young children I have played it with really enjoyed it. It was accessible for a 3 year old and fun for a 5 year old. They were challenged but still were able to compete with each other in a fun and engaged way despite their age differences. It was also fun for me as the adult playing. They improved over time as we played a few games. Seems like it could be great for many younger ages.
customer_reviews.author: shaz

customer_reviews.title: Super fun, super simple game that can be played ...
customer_reviews.text: It was midnight. The "game night" never materialized as the four of us ended up just eating and chatting all night. I started doing that thing where I look at my watch because I'm tired and the hostess said "hey - we said it was gonna be a game night... before you go do you wanna try this game Spot It! with me?" Three hours of screaming nouns at each other later we finally tore ourselves away. Super fun, super simple game that can be played with pretty much all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Brian E. Mcelaney

customer_reviews.title: Not Interesting
customer_reviews.text: Extremely boring and hardly a “game.” . Neither ages 5-8 nor 42-80 enjoyed it—at all!
customer_reviews.author: MRHM

customer_reviews.title: So Fun
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I got this. After reading several reviews, I opted to purchase, in hopes my twin 6 year old nieces and 8 year old nephew would enjoy this and enjoy this we all did. This game is relatively addicting and pretty fun, even for an adult. I know the age range wasn't kosher for the little ladies, but once they understood the concept, what they couldn't read, or what they didn't know, I just had them point out on the middle deck (I believe that is the first game you can play in the instruction sheet).
customer_reviews.author: Vader D

customer_reviews.title: Fun family game
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old son really enjoys this game. Very fun for the whole family and I love that it’s so many games in one. Would make a fun gift. Love that it’s compact and you can take it on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Super fun!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to learn/explain and so much fun to play! Five different versions of the game means you can play for awhile w/o getting bored. I like that your brain feels like it may explode while playing one version, but then you feel like a genius playing the very next version! Fun for 2 people or a group and easy to transport for travel. Very glad I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this game
customer_reviews.text: This game is great for a number of types of people. IT is a fun, fast game, it can be used with people with problems naming things due to stroke or other problems and coordination problems. GREAT as a gift, great for travel game and home game, young and old. Will buy as a gift for loved ones who will enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bock

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Easy and Fun
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought Spot It to bring on a trip to visit to my grandchildren. My granddaughter, 9 years old, and all the adults really love this game. It takes about 5 minutes to learn and about the same time to play a round. My granddaughter totally caught on to the game but was a little hard for her to keep the pace with the adults. If people are not too competitive this game is great for people 9 to whatever. We tinkered with two variations of the game and both were great. I am buying two more Spot It games for my house and for another family member.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia L. Terraciano

customer_reviews.title: So much fun! Great for all ages
customer_reviews.text: This is such a fun game to play with your family and friends. Its great for all ages! I've played this game with people ranging from 9yrs to 60yrs old and they have all loved it! It will definitely have you laughing and having a good time with your family and friends. For large groups I've used two sets to make sure theres enough cards.
customer_reviews.author: Ritz

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for all ages
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game for all ages. No reading required and even the parents and grandparents love it! It's a fun family game. Compact too, so it can be easily taken anywhere to share with family or friends. Instructions are included for variations on the basic game. A great gift.
customer_reviews.author: Grammy N.

customer_reviews.title: fun good quality game
customer_reviews.text: Awesome game. I played it with some friends and decided to get my own. Perfect for a couple quick short games when you don't know how much time you'll have to play. Cards are sturdy. My only complaint is that the box has been QUITE difficult to open each time I want to play and I end up pulling on it for a while and then it finally opens and spews cards everywhere but maybe that will lesson the more I use it. Maybe that's just my game. Other than that, fantastic game. Try it out. It's fun.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: It is the only thing that ALL my kids can play (ages 4-10) as well as adults and we all have an equal amount of fun. We rarely tire of it
customer_reviews.text: Have you played a lot of Candyland with a certain small child in your home? So much that you are ready to throw the game away and pretend that the dog ate it? Never fear, Spot It is here! This game keeps my family sane. It is the only thing that ALL my kids can play (ages 4-10) as well as adults and we all have an equal amount of fun. We rarely tire of it. And a game can be done in under 5 minutes! There are also multiple ways to play it so you never get bored.
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to play with my mother who is suffering from dementia. She has an aversion to electronics so this is a great diversion without her having to touch or maneuver anything. It's easy, yet doesn't feel like a kids game...everyone enjoys playing it with her. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MASLubbock

customer_reviews.title: Actually fun card game!
customer_reviews.text: This game is fantastic. I typically HATE board and card games but I do like sitting down to play this one with my young kids. It’s quick and fun, easy to learn, doesn’t require reading. There are several variations they like to rotate through. Many laughs and fun had with this one.
customer_reviews.author: DEM

customer_reviews.title: Family Fun!
customer_reviews.text: We bought the camping themed Spot It! as a gift for an out of town friend and his family last Christmas. They love to camp! We just saw him and were talking games with him. Forgetting from who his family received the game, he asked with a big smile on his face, "Have you ever played a game called Spot It!? It is so fun and there are several different ways you can play it!" He went on to tell us about all the different ways to play and why he liked each one. We were so happy to find it a success!
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Great game all ages can play together.
customer_reviews.text: We love this game. We had a family reunion and one of my nieces suggested this game. It is an easy game to learn but not as easy as you would think to play. All ages can play together which makes it really nice for families. It is fast moving so no one will be bored and it can be played anywhere you have a flat surface. Also it is just a deck of cards so not a lot to set up, clean up or store. I purchased several of these for Christmas gifts and everyone's feedback was positive.
customer_reviews.author: RRobb

customer_reviews.title: Such a simple game but so much fun
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a silly idea but we bought it as a learning tool for our adopted children to learn English. Oh my gosh this is so much fun and really addictive! Every person who has played this thinks it is a blast and this is always a hit on game night.
customer_reviews.author: El Conquistador

customer_reviews.title: Well made- fun game
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for us and as a gift. Fun for any age. Some days I can win every game. Other days I lose every game. Depends on how well my brain is working. Of course my kids love it when I am having an off day. Good quality cards. Several ways to play it. Instructions included.
customer_reviews.author: travelllllller

customer_reviews.title: What a fun game for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: I own a mixed age school, and this game has been a wonderful addition to the classroom! Students from K-5 grade have enjoyed playing this one! It is so simple to learn, and there are multiple ways to play. The cards are sturdy too, which is great when a lot of children are trying to play quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Best kids game
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this game so I bought it for several nieces and nephews for Christmas. It’s quick, easy to learn, and ages 3+ can learn it and play it. Sometimes you have to tell the older kids to let the little kids have a turn too. But we love it. It’s small and compact so it’s great to travel with too.
customer_reviews.author: Mikki

customer_reviews.title: Love this gave for kids
customer_reviews.text: My young daughter loves this game! We don't play as directed, but just use the cards to match and she loves finding the match. Challenging enough to keep her interested, but not too challenging that she gets discouraged. Perfect game for in the car or on a plane for playing this way.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Jakinovich

customer_reviews.title: My favorite game!!
customer_reviews.text: We have game night with our family and this just became one of our, if not the, favorite game for us to play. It is so simply to understand that even young kids can play and it is just so much fun!!! You need to add this to your family game nights!!
customer_reviews.author: Iliana Hinojosa

customer_reviews.title: Best game ever created
customer_reviews.text: This game is frustrating and addictive. I always hated board games and card games that take too long to complete and Spot It is the complete opposite. Great for all ages and there is no need to know English to play. I took it to Europe with me this summer and my cousins played with me for HOURS. I can’t recommend this game enough. I’ve purchased it as gifts and have hooked so many people on it. Can’t recommend this game enough!
customer_reviews.author: Maja Culum

customer_reviews.title: My family and friends love this game
customer_reviews.text: This game is easy to understand and new players can pick it up quickly. Each round is fast and players can enter and leave by round making it great for parties. We have played with young and old players and almost everyone has loved the game. I made my most recent purchase for my niblings to enjoy when at Grandma's house.
customer_reviews.author: SDPMP

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for the entire family! Age is just a number...
customer_reviews.text: Young and old, we all enjoyed this game. We played as a family on Christmas with kids from age 5-10 and adults from 26-62. All of us playing together was a hit. Age didn't seem to matter with this game. Some of the kids were naturals while some adults struggled. We laughed and played several rounds. It's a new family favorite.
customer_reviews.author: FerTom

customer_reviews.title: Great game, not packed as in pictures.
customer_reviews.text: This game is awesome, any age will have lots of fun with it. I have the camping version too. I would have rated it 5 stars but it came with no wrapper, just plastic and this makes it not perfect for a gift (which was my intention). In the photos they show it with the box and everything but it’s not how it arrived. Other than that is perfect to play at any place, any age.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Great Game
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my nephew turning 8. It's a great game. I already had them for my 9 year old daughter so I give them 5 stars on being giftable. The game is age appropriate and not one of those game you dread playing with a kid. It's fun for adults too. I would highly recommend this game.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M.

customer_reviews.title: And you will just feel like an idiot
customer_reviews.text: Don't play this with your teenagers, they have MUCH faster reflexes than you, I promise. And you will just feel like an idiot, even if you have a graduate degree, which I do. I'm not stupid, I swear! It's just that my daughters all have faster reflexes. I'm totally distraught about it. The game is absolutely entertaining and hilarious, but your kids are gonna school you at it. Next thing you know, they'll be kicking my butt at Halo. I'm not even 50! Getting old sucks. This game will remind you of that, unless you are someone's teenage daughter. In that case buy it now! And then humiliate your parents.
customer_reviews.author: Casuela

customer_reviews.title: Fun speedy and educational brain game
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game. I use it for therapy sessions with children to work on visual perception and selecting 1 image from many. It works both for children (prob. 1st grade and up) as well as challenge adults. And yes, there really is only 1 match between ANY 2 cards! The directions offer 4-5 various ways to play the game. I like portable card style games and this helps to stimulate neural brain patterns as well!
customer_reviews.author: janascally

customer_reviews.title: Not Our Favorite
customer_reviews.text: This game is great, and myself and my husband enjoy it as well as our four kids (8-15). The reason I gave it 4 stars is actually because we like the Hip version way more than this one. This is still a great game, but if Hip is 5 stars then this is 4. The pictures are just more fun on the Hip, and it's hilarious to hear my kids try to describe records (LPs) and stereos. :D
customer_reviews.author: The Real Me

customer_reviews.title: Keep This In Your Travel Bag
customer_reviews.text: Great family game to take while traveling or on vacation. Easily packed with not a bunch of different small pieces this is a great item to take for some down time. Even if one card gets lost, the game does not depend on it. It's not complicated so no huge learning curve or an hour of instruction. It's a great game for the kids alone or even to include the adults in. I highly recommend stashing one of these away in your vacation bag for some cheap entertainment when the kids are bored and you are wanting to enjoy some quiet time.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy + Mich

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Very fun and great value. Thought it would get too repetitive but it hasn’t. Having each card have one match really lends variety to the matches you can make. It’s fun being able to vary the game mode too. Highly highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Smith

customer_reviews.title: Huge hit
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a Christmas gift for a family of six that loves to play games. After reading the reviews thought this would be perfect for them with the kids ages 7-12. They absolutely love it!!! The kids started playing it as soon as I gave it to them. Love that there are five ways to play the game, which the kids loved. After one night of playing it, they started recommending to their other family member to get the game to play with their kids.
customer_reviews.author: Beana Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Such a fun game!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a fun game for the whole family and of all ages. We try to have weekly game nights with the kids, to spend quality family time together and this is a game everyone loves. It's also good for people who have concentration and memory issues as it helps with cognitive issues. When we have family get togethers and put our games out, this is one game that definitely gets used on a regular basis. I love how it comes in a small container, so it's easy to store away when not in use. There is a junior version available for younger kids. It was cheaper to buy online with Amazon then to purchase at Target!
customer_reviews.author: MissPriss

customer_reviews.title: Portable fun for the whole family!
customer_reviews.text: This game is great fun! My children (4, 5, and 8) all love to play. Instructions are clear and include the original game and multiple play variations. We started with the original game play version. It was easy to pick up and my younger kids were holding their own by the first or second play. We also easily learned the play variations, which keep it from getting old and boring to my kiddos. The size and the tin are perfect for keeping in the car or in my bag, and it has been an oft requested way to pass the time when waiting at restaurants.
customer_reviews.author: awndr

customer_reviews.title: Visual or auditory acuity
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for traveling. My boys enjoy it as a game. Also, it works incredibly well for developing visual or auditory acuity. I let one son (who is weak in visual skills) look at a card for 60 seconds (less time as he improved), then took it and asked him to tell me what items were on the card. For another son (who is weak in auditory skills) I tell him what is on the card, and he tries to repeat back as many as he can. I started with just two pictures on each card, and he has built up over two months now to six.
customer_reviews.author: Higgies

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great game for kids, head-injuries, senior-moment training, strokes, etc. It has enough variability that you don't learn the deck. Great idea for brain "plasticity". It's more than just a game that's fun it's therapy if you want it. As a counselor and a caregiver, I give a big thumbs-up!
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Great Game for Classrooms!
customer_reviews.text: Spot-It is one of the best games that I have in my classroom and in my home. Children as young as 5 quickly learn how to play and even my 4th graders still enjoy the opportunity to play it. When my grandsons visit, this is a game that they can happily play together or with me for long stretches without getting tired of it. But my favorite part of this game is how it sharpens observation skills - paying attention to the different shapes, comparing them and recognizing which ONE shape is different helps children to be able to develop those critical thinking skills that we want all young people to develop. Spot-It will always be in my classroom!
customer_reviews.author: Felting Mom

customer_reviews.title: Our 9 year old loves this game!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as an Easter basket gift and our 9 year old totally loves it. We all do! We normally play it in groups of 2 or 3 of us as a family after our youngest goes to bed. It's a fun game for everyone :)
customer_reviews.author: Kh2011

customer_reviews.title: Cute game for all ages
customer_reviews.text: Really cute game! My 4 year olds love this game and are pretty dang good at it! The boys like it because it’s easy enough for them but yet it’s not a “kid” game. Really cute and would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Coradi

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, high speed fun
customer_reviews.text: I love this game. It has simplicity, skill, and is very easy to learn. It blows my mind every time I play it as the matches can be very hard to make every when they're lying in plain sight. All in all, it's easy to gift, learn, and play.
customer_reviews.author: J Person

customer_reviews.title: Tiny!! Looks Cheap.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a Christmas gift---the ad is very deceiving. The ad makes it look about 6" in diameter but the tin can itself is only about 3"-3 1/2" round x <1" thick. Like a 2015 review I just read said, I too was shocked and embarrassed to use this as a Santa party gift (ages 3 1/2 - 85) so I added money to the box I put it in because it looked so "cheap." Will have to wait to hear if the game is any fun.
customer_reviews.author: debbiem

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gift!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my grandkids for Easter but decided to play it early - they are 4 and 5 years old. They loved it! Didn't take too long for their mother to become interested and the whole family played. Easily transportable to trips.
customer_reviews.author: Shellbow

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent game to pull out and challenge the kids. It helps with object recognition and great for people that have never played. We have two versions in the house and this is my preferred style.
customer_reviews.author: Show-Me Long Island

customer_reviews.title: Great for autistic children.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 4 year old that is on the spectrum. Being he is somewhat detail oriented I thought this would be good for him. It works out very well. He loves it. At first it was used at dinner time. He is not a very good eater. The only way anyone gets a turn is when he eats some food. When he does everyone gets a turn(mom, dad, him). It is something he loves doing and he is so good at it that it has become a very good tool to get him to eat. It also gives him confidence since he can actually play a game and do well with other people including adults.
customer_reviews.author: Me_So_Honey

customer_reviews.title: Brings family together to play!
customer_reviews.text: A great game for kids and adults to play together! Kids very often beat the adults. The concept is easy enough for my 4 year old to play, but she isn't quite as fast if playing with older kids and/or adults (though sometimes she can beat us!). Fast-paced enough to keep adults interested, and I love that the instructions included suggest several different ways to play--we often play 3 different types of games in one sitting to mix things up, and because some of the games are easier for some people than others. Highly recommend, and have bought to give as a gift as well. Love that it is small and portable--easy to pack for on the go fun!
customer_reviews.author: J. T.

customer_reviews.title: FUN GAME!!
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson had this game, we played it many times with him and enjoyed it so much, we bought it for our 7-year old granddaughter. She wants to play it every time we visit. Fun for children and adults!!
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Great fast game for all ages.
customer_reviews.text: What a simple concept, but a great game for all ages. It's really hard to find a kids' game that isn't mind-numbingly boring, requires some modicum of skill, yet isn't always easily won by a parent (or won by the child every time for parents who aren't as competitive as me!!). Spot It is easy to learn and easy to play. Every pair of cards share one and only one picture. Be the first to find the one that matches the card in your hand, and that's it! The instructions give you a couple of variations to play. It's fast and can be replayed multiple times in one sitting. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Cosci

customer_reviews.title: Very fun!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love! It’s so fun and I can use it with my baby cousins as well as a drinking game with my adult buddies. It’s so much fun and easy to travel with. Play it anytime, anywhere. Wonderful game! I ended up buying a few as gifts. It’s great.
customer_reviews.author: Hoang

customer_reviews.title: Love this game!
customer_reviews.text: We love this game. It is fun with children and with adults. It is a quick, fast paced game that is small and you can take it with you places easily. The tin can is a nice portable container. The cards are good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Britney Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Super fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: This arrived super fast and much sooner than expected. Immediately started playing with our soon to be 4 year old and he caught in right away. Super fun game that truly levels the playing field. He often beat me and I was trying my hardest! Great game to keep stashed in my purse for restaurants or other waiting times. I plan to order a second set and it’s my new go-to gift for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Kit C.

customer_reviews.title: It is a fun game and the kids like it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game to use in my work as an occupational therapist with children for the purpose of developing their visual perceptual skills. It is a fun game and the kids like it. Initially it's pretty challenging, but once your eyes and brain get the concept it's fun. I love all the different versions they are making now, and Spot It Jr. is great for "beginners" or younger kids. Thanks for making my work fun!
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Fun party game
customer_reviews.text: Simple idea, well-implemented. Wish there were many more games like this. For 2 - 4 people. This is one of those games that kids should play as they think about how they interact with others online.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Crocker

customer_reviews.title: Portable, fast game, and works for mixed languages
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a family Christmas gift, and it was a big hit. It's super easy to learn, and good for all language levels. My Japanese parents were able to play, they said the symbol names in Japanese and we said it in English. It's small, portable, and a fast game so we kept taking it with us to cafes, shops to play.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn - fun for kids and adults (seriously!)
customer_reviews.text: I hate games that are complicated and that involve strategy. This is the antithesis of that. Easy to learn. Sharpens eye coordination and mental focus. I can play it with my 6 year old or another adult. Quick, good, clean fun! Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dagirlgenius

customer_reviews.title: Great game for all & compact.
customer_reviews.text: Any version of this game is fun! Great for any age, 4 to adult! Kids love it. Good for memory & eye hand coordination in kids. Good small travel game. I keep one in my camper. Super tin container!!
customer_reviews.author: Evava

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this game
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this game. It is so fun and the tin can is the perfect size to through in my purse and have on me at all times. Since it is a tin case, I don't have to worry about the case getting ruined either! I will whip this game out whenever my kids are bored. It's a perfect waiting game at a restaurant or at the doctor's office.
customer_reviews.author: Nereyda

customer_reviews.title: Challenging and fun
customer_reviews.text: This is a really challenging game! I got this for my niece who struggles with reading and attention, and, so far, she is the champion of this game! Adults and kids can play this, and adults don't need to go "easy" on the kids because the game's design levels the playing field. We like that you can play different "versions" of the game, too. Always challenging and always fun.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Peters

customer_reviews.title: Perfect game for non verbal.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect gift and easy to learn. Do not need to be verbal. I use this with my work with non verbal patients. It's great also for any age and any language. The pictures are clear and fun!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Very fun family game.
customer_reviews.text: I am 8 years old . I like the game Spot It because it is a very fun family game and instructions are easy to follow. 'Spot It' brings laughter into your home. I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Great Game, very versatile
customer_reviews.text: I send presents to various great nieces and nephews from Amazon, I have prime, so lots of free shipping, plus none of the hassle. I have purchased this game and the junior version several times. Parents love it, almost everyone can play some version, it has different games you can play in instructions, so they don't get tired of it. It fits in purses, diaper bags, backpacks. The first time I sent it, I saw photo's of them playing it online.....I asked their mom if they were really able to play, she said yes, they really do....and her godchild had a birthday coming up, she was going to send them the same game. I considered that a good endorsement
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Turnbough

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Game!
customer_reviews.text: Our family loves this game. We take it everywhere. The tin container makes it easy to keep everything together and slip into a bag or purse. My 12, 14, and 41 year love the game.
customer_reviews.author: w106bmb

customer_reviews.title: Fun fun fun while you learn!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike! Hours of fun while learning concentration! Purchased for classroom, grandchildren, nephew and friends! Great for memory too!Wish I could buy stink in the company!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: My sister had this game and we played when I visited her for a few days. OMG, it was sooo fun I had to buy it when I got home. It's handy to take in your purse and play with someone while waiting in a restaurant or on an airplane, or just at home. Amazingly addictive!
customer_reviews.author: Jill Whalen

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy playing this game with my family, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Great game for kids as young as 3. No reading involved except a couple of the pictures are stylized words like "ART". There's also a lot of different variations suggested to keep it interesting. It's also portable, we take it to restaurants sometimes. Another plus is that adults don't really have a distinct advantage. When I play this with my 6 year old, games are usually very close and competitive without me going easy on him. This is not because the game is luck based, as is the case with other kids games that I don't like to play.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul Pawa

customer_reviews.title: Compact Fun
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewers have done a great job of covering the ins and outs of the game play. I will simply echo that this a great fast paced, easy to pick up game for players of all ages--and as someone who has played a fair share of games, I can say that's no easy feat. In addition, the entire game fits in a very small sized nice looking tin, giving it the edge over many of it's competitors that just add another clunky box to a shelf in your closet.
customer_reviews.author: Bridgie

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for all ages
customer_reviews.text: Got this for myself and some friends! we got creative with it during our christmas party. Love this game. They tell you a few ways on how to play. My friends and I play it a little differently. We have one person who is the "card flipper" let's say there is 5 of us playing. Everyone is gathered around, and the flipper turns over 2 cards. The first person to say " spot it ___matching object___" gets to keep the 2 cards.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzzzz

customer_reviews.title: Super fun and easy to play!
customer_reviews.text: My kids are 4 and 5 and we all love to play this together! I thought it might be too old for them, but they caught on immediately and they’re FAST! Perfect gift or party game!
customer_reviews.author: Joeyc

customer_reviews.title: Fun game. Easy to play and trasport
customer_reviews.text: Everyonr always has fun playing this game. 2 or more players-easy and various games can be played. A great take along game as it is contained in a nice small tin. Grandkids are 9,8,7,6,5 and they all loved it. A little difficult for grandpa-ha ha
customer_reviews.author: Linda Deeb

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Enjoyable for my 3 year old and every adult playing with her. No blinking lights, no batteries, just good, imaginative fun. Can make up many games with the cards, or play the several versions in the included booklet.
customer_reviews.author: zefir68

customer_reviews.title: Great for plane rides or waiting rooms
customer_reviews.text: Great game, keeps 6 year olds attention long enough for airplane ride or while waiting at appt. it is a good time occupier that doesn’t require lots of assistance or setup from mom.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: A must-have!
customer_reviews.text: Best game ever! It is the go-to game in our family as everyone can play. It can be played in only minutes but it so fun you could play for hours. We have three of these, one in each car, and one in the closet, fits nicely in a diaper bag or purse. My husband and I will play just the two of us, so it is not for kids only. Helps keep our minds and eyes sharp. It has been our favorite gift to give for birthday parties. I wish it were a little less expensive considering it is only a card game but the cards are sturdy and the tin keeps them that way.
customer_reviews.author: S. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for family game nights and for travel!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a fun game to have in case of rain when we were going on a beach vacation. It was great for our family, especially since my son loves I Spy type books and games. We modify the directions of play a bit but it's still fun for all of us to play together. I like that this can be as easy or complex as you make it. We will be playing this game for years and years to come as our family grows. I always toss this in the bag when we do picnics, vacations, family gatherings, etc. It's small to toss in a bag and fun for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: jfamatl

customer_reviews.title: A filler game - easy and fun
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th one in 6 weeks :-) My wife is a teacher. She plays this game with her after schoolers. We bought one for home use few weeks back. I liked it. Few weeks back when her cousin's family visited, we introduced it to them. They enjoyed playing and we gifted it to them. Bought 2nd one. Couple of weeks back we took it to a dinner party with friends. We left it there since they liked. Bought 3rd one 2 weeks back. My son came home for the weekend, played it for sometime and took it with him.. So here comes 4th one... hope this stays :-)
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Love the games and I’m glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son as something different to play and we had a blast. Would definitely recommend-he asks me to play with him more often than not, so I’m very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CourtneyFreng

customer_reviews.title: Great family game to entertain all ages!
customer_reviews.text: Huge hit with my 5-year-old niece, and just as fun for family members of all ages to play with her. There are several different ways you can play, which keeps things fresh, and in each variation, there is no need to "let her" win the round. She is quite capable on her own. It's surprising sometimes just how challenging it is to spot the match. The cards come in a tin that's small enough to tuck in a purse or coat pocket and play anywhere, like when dining out and waiting for the meal to arrive. Planning on buying other versions as well.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Dreamin'

customer_reviews.title: Even Grandma likes this game!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a grandma and after playing this game with my grandchildren at their house, I told my husband I wanted my own game of Spot It to have here at home. Even a 5 yr old can play! This is one of my favorite games ever!
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: This game is Super Fun!
customer_reviews.text: This game is so fun to play. I already have one at home & one in the camper. Now I needed one go in my classroom! Great for all ages! Even my 5 year old loves to pla
customer_reviews.author: Jill T.

customer_reviews.title: Fun and easy!
customer_reviews.text: I can state from experience that this is a great game for an eight-year-old boy, a five-year-old boy, and an adult not good at games. It's based on visual recognition of illustrated objects. I am not usually quick to catch on to the rules of a game, but I got the rules for Spot It with one quick reading of the instructions card. The cards are round, colorful and cheerful. I lost every round to the boys. I was rewarded with screams of delight from my little opponents. Parents and babysitters of all ages, you'll be glad you got this!
customer_reviews.author: Patto

customer_reviews.title: Good for any age.
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter taught me how to play this..now my husband and I ( both retired), keep it close by, and we play it, keeps your mind sharp, then boggles it..a fun game..
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy game
customer_reviews.text: Great card game for children. I got this as a present for my 6 year old grandchild and it was loved by all of the family. The cards are stored in a metal can. We would just flip over two cards at a time, finding the one symbol that was the same on those two cards. It was great due to the fact that we would go thru all of the cards in just a few minutes, so my grandchild had no problems getting the adults to play with her. Also due to the fact that the games were so short, she did not get bored with the game.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L

customer_reviews.title: Very different, very fun family and friend game. Kids and adults alike
customer_reviews.text: We just played this game tonight for the first time. There are several ways to play with these cards and we all found ourselves laughing so much having a great time! I’d encourage you to purchase this game and play with kids or adults alike. Try all the different versions included in the instructions. You can have a blast with this one!
customer_reviews.author: David Little

product_meta.title: Spot It! (Color/Packaging May Vary)
product_meta.description: Test your observational skills and your reflexes with the award-winning gameplay of Spot It! A game of lightning-fast choices for two to eight players. With dozens of awards and possible versions married to elegant gameplay, Spot It! has become a global phenomenon. Five distinct mini-games within a set of Spot It! Ensure that the game will be different every time you play, and because it’s always your turn, there’s never any downtime! Color/ packaging may vary.
feature_bullets: Award winning game of visual perception for the whole family
Between any two cards there is always one and only one matching symbol; Spot it fast to win
Five challenging ways to play for hours of frenzied fun for 2 to 8 players
Develops focus, visual perception skills, speech language skills, and fine motor skills
Includes 55 cards and illustrated rules in a durable travel size tin; Brands may vary

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars6,291 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
